content.raw:
So I started modifying the script. In many places it seems to be more suitable to use xsd:any instead of the automated way. In some places, it does not. I find the approach of describing the format in several files with a .sdf suffix rather strange in general. Imho it would have been better to define a XSD and use this for creating the DOM. 

Perhaps you could help me by clarifying some points. In the <model> element, is it possible to have <links> and <joints> in arbitrary order and numbers and <self_collide> only appear once? The specification does not state clearly any restrictions to the order.
Further, I do not think that it is possible to define this with XSD at all (in arbitrary order) – xsd:all does not allow for multiple elements of the same type and the combination of sequence/choice does not prevent multiple <self_collide> elements.
